basics.name: Mason Daugherty
basics.label: Software Engineer, LangChain
basics.summary: Bowdoin College Computer Science '25 full-stack engineer specializing in event-driven backends and real-time integrations. I turn manual workflows into reliable, automated systems using Python, Java, TypeScript, FastAPI, Spring Boot, React, and Docker. Proven track record shipping production tools across open-source repos.

work.name: Teens to Trails
work.description: Nonprofit connecting Maine teens to the outdoors
work.summary: Nonprofit connecting Maine teens to the outdoors
highlights: Designed and implemented Express.js integrations to automate accounting tasks using Airtable and QuickBooks APIs; reduced manual data entry by over six hours weekly
Leveraged Waterfall & Kanban methodologies to design, build, and provide ongoing training for a cross departmental project planning tool, resulting in org-wide adoption

Led recommendation and implementation of Apple Business Essentials for Zero-Touch MDM Deployment for new company devices, automating setup with federated authentication and security-first configuration profiles and apps, reducing setup time by over 50%

work.name: WBOR 91.1 FM
highlights: Supervised 200+ student and community DJs while enforcing FCC guidelines, managing day-to-day operations and schedule, and coordinating delivery of live broadcasting to 30,000+ online & FM listeners
Modernized the station's tech stack by building a new website, and integrating real-time WebSocket streaming for metadata distribution to third-party platforms (TuneIn, Apple Music, Last.fm)
Implemented a Twilio-powered "Text the DJ" feature and off-site audio streaming server, resulting in a 30% reliability improvement and 500+ weekly texts from listeners
Configured and maintained network infrastructure for broadcast equipment, including TCP/IP-based audio streaming, DHCP assignments, DNS config, and REST API integrations for automation and monitoring

Built and maintained the station's website. Integrated features such as real-time program schedules, DJ profiles, and automated song logging. Alongside this, deployed and configured a new off-site audio streaming server, increasing listener capacity and reducing downtime by 30%
Wrote 40000+ words of documentation (best practices, admin tool guidelines, software maintenance & troubleshooting, recurring processes & procedures) and created adaptable design diagrams
Principle project manager and developer for numerous microservices: github.com/wbor-fm/
Strengthened station security by implementing 1Password Enterprise with SSO, streamlining account management and preserving institutional knowledge through rigorous (40,000+ words) documentation
Compile quarterly reports to be submitted on behalf of Bowdoin College to the Federal Communications Commission
Engage 100% of the 1,100+ recorded WBOR Alumni

work.name: Bowdoin College Information Technology
highlights: Assist in event production and provide technical support for various campus events, such as graduation, guest lecturers, and the inauguration for Bowdoin's sixteenth president.
Partnered with event stakeholders to translate technical requirements, swiftly troubleshooting and resolving technical issues in real-time under pressure
Used TeamDynamix ITSM to generate/maintain detailed ticket records and update documentation
Mentored and trained new technicians alongside the Event Production Coordinator

work.name: LACORE Enterprises
highlights: Orchestrated comprehensive rebranding initiatives across six corporate entities, encompassing website design, on-site visual content creation, and streamlined online consistency
Strategically aligned brand vision through regular supervisor consultations, culminating in a cohesive online identity
Conducted virtual audits for accreditation bodies such as NSF and ISO (17025)
Optimized  internal operations by developing in-house hiring intake forms

volunteer.organization: McKeen Center for the Common Good

awards.title: StudentCam Grand Prize Winner
awards.summary: Produced winning documentary and was recognized on the US Congress House Floor by Congressman Van Taylor for helping to engage youth and bring awareness to the powers of citizen accountability in government
